question_text: A company is running a media store across multiple Amazon EC2 instances distributed across multiple Availability Zones in a single VPC. The company wants a high-performing solution to share data between all the EC2 instances, and prefers to keep the data within the VPC only. What should a solutions architect recommend?

options.A: Create an Amazon S3 bucket and call the service APIs from each instance's application
options.B: Create an Amazon S3 bucket and configure all instances to access it as a mounted volume
options.C: Configure an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume and mount it across all instances
options.D: Configure an Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) file system and mount it across all instances
